    "size": 39174,
    "content": "# Hypernet Development Priorities
## Prioritized Development Roadmap with Critical Path Analysis

**Version:** 1.0
**Date:** February 9, 2026
**Status:** Active
**Owner:** Development Team (CTO when hired)
**Review Cycle:** Weekly for P0, Bi-weekly for P1, Monthly for P2

---

## Executive Summary

This document provides a prioritized development roadmap for Hypernet, establishing the critical path from current state (strategic foundation complete, APIs ready) to market-ready product with 1,000 users in 90 days.

### Current State
- Strategic foundation: 100% complete
- API development: 100% complete (115+ endpoints)
- Database design: 85% complete (designed, not deployed)
- Team: 2 people (founder + AI advisor)
- Users: 0
- Revenue: $0

### 90-Day Goal
- Team: 8-12 people (CTO, engineers, advisors)
- Users: 1,000 active beta users
- Revenue: $30K MRR
- Funding: $5-7.5M seed round closed
- Partnerships: 1-2 LOIs signed

### Critical Path
The shortest path to success requires executing 4 parallel tracks:
1. **Team Building** - Hire CTO and core team
2. **Product Development** - Launch working beta platform
3. **Fundraising** - Close seed round
4. **Partnerships** - Sign first deals

---

## Priority System

### P0 - Critical (Blocking, Must Do Now)
Items that block everything else. If not done, nothing else can proceed.
- Timeline: Days to 2 weeks
- Review: Daily standups
- Ownership: Founder (Matt) or CTO

### P1 - High Priority (Essential for Success)
Items essential for MVP and market launch. Can proceed in parallel with P0.
- Timeline: 2-4 weeks
- Review: Weekly
- Ownership: Technical leads

### P2 - Medium Priority (Important but Not Blocking)
Items that enhance the product but aren't required for initial launch.
- Timeline: 1-3 months
- Review: Bi-weekly
- Ownership: Team members

### P3 - Low Priority (Future)
Items that can wait until after initial traction.
- Timeline: 3+ months
- Review: Monthly
- Ownership: To be assigned

---

## Track 1: Team Building (P0 - Critical)

### Overview
Without a team, we cannot build the product. Team building is the #1 blocker.

### Success Criteria
- CTO hired within 60 days
- 3-5 advisors secured within 60 days
- Fractional CFO engaged within 30 days
- 2-3 engineers hired within 90 days

### Dependencies
- Fundraising materials (✅ Complete)
- Company incorporation (⏳ Not started)
- Compensation packages defined (⏳ Not started)

---

### P0-T1: CTO Recruitment (Week 1-8)

**Priority:** P0 - CRITICAL BLOCKER
**Timeline:** 60 days
**Owner:** Matt (Founder)
**Status:** Not started

#### Week 1-2: Job Description and Outreach
- [ ] Day 1: Write CTO job description
  - Technical requirements (Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, AI/ML)
  - Compensation (8-12% equity + $150-200K salary)
  - Role description (technical leadership, product development, team building)
  - Company vision and opportunity
- [ ] Day 1: Post on YC Co-founder Matching
- [ ] Day 1: Post on LinkedIn with promoted post ($500 budget)
- [ ] Day 2: Post on Twitter/X with thread
- [ ] Day 2: Identify 20 potential candidates (LinkedIn search)
- [ ] Day 3-5: Research warm intro paths for top 10 candidates
- [ ] Day 3-5: Send cold outreach emails to other 10 candidates
- [ ] Week 2: Follow up with all candidates

**Success Metrics:**
- 50+ applications received
- 20+ qualified candidates identified
- 10+ first conversations scheduled

#### Week 3-4: First Round Interviews
- [ ] Week 3: 15-20 first-round calls (30 minutes each)
  - Technical background assessment
  - Culture fit evaluation
  - Compensation expectations
  - Availability timeline
- [ ] Week 3-4: Select 5-7 candidates for deep dive
- [ ] Week 4: Send technical challenge to finalists

**Success Metrics:**
- 15+ first rounds completed
- 5-7 strong candidates advancing
- Technical challenges sent

#### Week 5-6: Deep Dive Interviews
- [ ] Week 5: Review technical challenges (with advisor support)
- [ ] Week 5: 3-4 hour deep dive interviews (top 3-5 candidates)
  - Technical deep dive (architecture, databases, APIs)
  - Product vision alignment
  - Team building approach
  - Reference checks
- [ ] Week 6: Select top 2 candidates
- [ ] Week 6: Make verbal offers

**Success Metrics:**
- 3-5 deep dives completed
- Top 2 candidates identified
- Verbal offers extended

#### Week 7-8: Close and Onboard
- [ ] Week 7: Negotiate final terms
- [ ] Week 7: Close CTO hire
- [ ] Week 7: Issue equity documents (with lawyer)
- [ ] Week 8: CTO onboarding begins
  - Review all strategic documentation
  - Review all technical code
  - Set up development environment
  - First technical decisions

**Success Metrics:**
- CTO signed and onboarded
- Development environment ready
- Technical roadmap reviewed

**Blockers:**
- Can't find qualified candidates → Expand search, increase equity package
- Can't compete on compensation → Focus on equity/vision, find true believers
- Timeline too long → Consider fractional CTO or contract CTO initially

---

### P0-T2: Advisory Board (Week 1-8)

**Priority:** P0 - CRITICAL
**Timeline:** 60 days
**Owner:** Matt (Founder)
**Status:** Not started

#### Week 1-2: Advisor Identification
- [ ] Day 1: Create advisor target list (10-15 potential advisors)
  - AI expert (Anthropic/OpenAI alum)
  - Privacy lawyer (GDPR/CCPA expertise)
  - GTM expert (B2B2C experience)
  - Fundraising expert (VC or angel investor)
- [ ] Day 2-3: Research warm intro paths
- [ ] Day 3-5: Send outreach emails (warm intros preferred)

**Success Metrics:**
- 10-15 advisors identified
- Outreach sent to all
- 5+ positive responses

#### Week 3-4: Advisor Meetings
- [ ] Week 3: First meetings with 5-7 potential advisors (30 min each)
  - Share vision and strategy
  - Discuss how they can help
  - Gauge interest level
  - Discuss compensation (0.25-0.5% equity)
- [ ] Week 4: Follow-up meetings with top 3-5

**Success Metrics:**
- 5+ advisor meetings
- 3-5 advisors interested
- Role scopes defined

#### Week 5-8: Close First Advisors
- [ ] Week 5-6: Make formal offers to top 3-5 advisors
- [ ] Week 6-7: Close first 2-3 advisors
- [ ] Week 7-8: Issue advisor agreements and equity
- [ ] Week 8: First advisor meetings (monthly cadence)

**Success Metrics:**
- 3-5 advisors signed
- Equity issued
- Monthly meeting schedule established

**Advisor Roles:**
- AI Advisor: Technical architecture, AI integration, ML strategy
- Privacy Advisor: Legal compliance, privacy features, security
- GTM Advisor: Marketing strategy, partnerships, sales
- Fundraising Advisor: Investor intros, pitch feedback, negotiation

---

### P0-T3: Fractional CFO (Week 1-4)

**Priority:** P0 - CRITICAL (needed for fundraising)
**Timeline:** 30 days
**Owner:** Matt (Founder)
**Status:** Not started

#### Week 1: CFO Sourcing
- [ ] Day 1: Create CFO job description
  - Financial modeling
  - Investor relations
  - Cap table management
  - Fundraising support
- [ ] Day 1-2: Post on Upwork and CFO networks
- [ ] Day 2-3: Research fractional CFO agencies
- [ ] Day 3-5: Identify 5-10 candidates
- [ ] Week 1: Schedule 5+ first calls

**Success Metrics:**
- 10+ candidates identified
- 5+ first calls scheduled

#### Week 2-3: CFO Selection
- [ ] Week 2: First round interviews (45 min each)
  - Experience with startups
  - Financial modeling expertise
  - Investor relations experience
  - Availability (10-20 hours/week)
- [ ] Week 2: Request work samples (financial models)
- [ ] Week 3: Select top candidate
- [ ] Week 3: Make offer ($10-15K/month + 0.5-1% equity)

**Success Metrics:**
- 5+ interviews completed
- Top candidate selected
- Offer extended

#### Week 4: CFO Onboarding
- [ ] Week 4: Close CFO engagement
- [ ] Week 4: Onboard with strategic documents
- [ ] Week 4: First tasks:
  - Review financial model
  - Build Excel/Sheets version
  - Set up cap table (Carta)
  - Support fundraising efforts

**Success Metrics:**
- CFO engaged
- Financial model spreadsheet built
- Cap table set up
- Supporting fundraising

---

### P1-T1: Engineering Team (Week 4-12)

**Priority:** P1 - HIGH (after CTO hired)
**Timeline:** 8 weeks
**Owner:** CTO
**Status:** Blocked by CTO hire

#### Week 4-6: First Engineers (2-3 people)
- [ ] Week 4: CTO defines hiring plan
- [ ] Week 4-5: Post job descriptions
- [ ] Week 5-6: Interview and hire 2-3 engineers
  - Full-stack engineer (Python, React)
  - Backend engineer (APIs, databases)
  - DevOps engineer (deployment, infrastructure)

**Success Metrics:**
- Job descriptions posted
- 50+ applications
- 2-3 engineers hired by Month 3

---

## Track 2: Product Development (P0 - Critical)

### Overview
Must have a working product to get users and validate market.

### Success Criteria
- Database deployed (development and staging)
- Testing implemented (70% coverage)
- First integration working (Google or Instagram)
- Frontend MVP launched
- Private beta ready (1,000 user capacity)

### Dependencies
- CTO hired (for technical leadership)
- Engineers hired (for development capacity)
- Database infrastructure (cloud provider selected)

---

### P0-P1: Database Deployment (Week 1-3)

**Priority:** P0 - CRITICAL
**Timeline:** 3 weeks
**Owner:** Matt (Week 1-2), CTO (Week 3+)
**Status:** Not started

#### Week 1: Alembic Migrations
- [ ] Day 1-2: Set up Alembic
- [ ] Day 2-3: Create initial migration from SQLAlchemy models
- [ ] Day 3-4: Review m
